intro: Pimelea confertiflora, commonly known as the denseflowered pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes junipers and cypress trees. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in whorls around the stems. Pimelea confertiflora is often found in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
